page.title: 11THE MILL HOUSE AT GLYNDE
page.content: The Mill House stands on a hill above the quarry. It is in Glynde village but in the parish of Beddingham. The owner told us that it had been a windmill for grinding corn. She has lived there with her family for more than 20 years and has put in electricity and running water. The family have added two extra bedrooms and a living room and have built walls with flints from the Downs. When they were making a swimming pool they found two whole mill stones and part of another. These now form the steps of the pool. The view from the house had attracted the owner to Glynde and she found it a friendly and happy place, because everyone knows everyone else. It is not too cut off because of the railway and the County Rider Bus Service. For entertainment there is an annual flower show and a silver band.
